blog.name: boundingintocomics
blog.title: Bounding Into Comics
blog.description: Your Best Source for News, Reviews, and Opinion when it comes to Comics!

summary: Comic Book Review: Captain Marvel #2
title: Comic Book Review: Captain Marvel #2
body:
Comic Book Review: Captain Marvel #2

Wherein we get a Sophomore slump in a plot that didn’t have a lot of wiggle room to begin with, a colorist that’s still destroying the art, and an artist that still maintains some semblance of quality despite the lack of light, shadow and depth.

It’s Still Better Than Anything Done With This Character In The Last Few Years, But…

is mostly filler and setup for what will hopefully pay off a lot…

View On WordPress

summary: Captain Marvel #2 (2019)
title: Captain Marvel #2 (2019)
body: CaptainMarvel #2 (2019) #AmandaConner & #PaulMounts Cover & Carmen #NunezCarnero Pencils, #KellyThompson Story REVOLUTION! The classic Fantastic Four villain #MAHKIZMO has taken over Manhattan’s Roosevelt Island and turned it into an apocalyptic wasteland! When CAPTAIN MARVEL ends up trapped there and cut off from the rest of world (including any Avengers-shaped reinforcements!), she’ll need to build her own team out of allies, old and new - SPIDER-WOMAN, HAZMAT, ECHO and a man known only as SOM - in order to start a revolution to free the island’s civilian inhabitants. With that kind of backup, Mahkizmo should be toast - but not everything is what it seems on this island… BUY

summary: Captain Marvel = Marvel’s The Last Jedi?
title: Captain Marvel = Marvel’s The Last Jedi?
body:
When seeing previews for The Last Jedi, I never thought how much of a mess that movie would turn out to be. Granted, it was good overall, but really managed to disappoint me and become so… cliched…

Marvel Studios’ Captain Marvel may turn in the same fate. But previews have already given a majority of people the same fleeting feeling that this film is going to just go for an agenda, much like the Star Wars franchise has. For this analysis, I’ve been looking into Wikipedia for information on what this movie has to offer. I may go off on a tangent or two, so please forgive me if I do.

The first issue fans have with this soon-to-be film is its lead actress, Brie Larson. Brie is an Oscar-winning actress, but even with accolades, she’s still prone to faults. Recently, news has come out that she took the role of Carol Danvers as a form of being an activist, which I don’t think sends the right message to fans. I mean, it shouldn’t just be a job, but it also shouldn’t directly influencing viewers. Brie’s also made headlines for wanting more diversity in critics. Okay, that’s fine and all… but basically calling out white men as the majority and saying there’s too much? Is that really what you want to do? 

Brie, I haven’t seen many movies with you, but I think this is the wrong move. You’re demonizing the guys who are going to watch your movie because it’s supposed to be this blockbuster epic. On top of that, it’ll only make things worse by the time the first reviews come around. 

Regardless of the outcome of reviews, I’m still seeing this movie. One, I want to continue seeing how the Marvel Cinematic Universe expands from this. And two, I just love seeing superhero movies in general. So Brie Larson’s activism doesn’t turn me away, but it does for others. And I can totally understand their points.

Right now, the film is tracking for $100+ million on opening weekend. That’s not bad at all, but definitely lower than earlier projections had cited around $160 million. The film’s budget of $159 million will surely be met. Now the problem becomes what will fans take away from this. People are already boycotting this movie because of what agenda it’s bringing. It hasn’t even come out yet. 

Say what you will about The Last Jedi, but I barely saw any form of anger towards pandering and activism when trailers were coming around. So why now? Is it because we can no longer trust Disney to do right by these kinds of films? Well considering that Black Panther, Avengers: Infinity War, and Ant-Man and the Wasp did reasonably well at the box office, I’d say Disney was doing fine with their Marvel properties.

And thus brings us to the problem: Promoting a woman who turns out to be a superhero instead of a superhero who turns out to be a woman. Let’s face it, Carol Danvers is not exactly a beloved Marvel character… at least from what I’ve seen and read. But of course, people can warm to the character if they’re given something inspiring and not something that panders to certain audiences.

What we have here with Captain Marvel is Brie Larson playing the role of an activist, not a superhero. And that’s what seems to be the problem. If Brie took the role with the goal in mind to become Carol Danvers rather than become an activist, I think there would be a different consensus amongst those in the fandom. Tone down the rhetoric, be a hero on screen and inspire people through your movie rather than just telling us that’s what you’re doing. It ruins the fun for people. And… it might ruin the fun for me, too.

Huh… Hopefully, the trailers were just there for show and not in the final product. There were questionable lines, weird CGI issues, and some other nitpicks. But there will be good stuff in this movie. There’s so much more than just Brie Larson. We have Samuel L. Jackson, Clark Gregg, Jude Law, Gemma Chan, and so many more talented actors and actresses.

Plus, I’m already impressed with the makeup and digital de-aging effects. The Skrulls look amazing. Though… something about them seems off without the black parts atop their heads… Eh, another nitpick. Anyways, the movie should be fun enough. Looking forward to March, everyone!

blog.name: rapeculturerealities
blog.title: Experiences with Rape Culture
blog.description: Sharing information about & calling out rape culture. A blog for survivors & activists. If you have a comment /question or would like to share an experience we would love to hear from you. TERFS /SWERFS DO NOT INTERACT

summary: Brie Larson Can Push a Car but of Course Men Have a Problem With It
title: Brie Larson Can Push a Car but of Course Men Have a Problem With It
excerpt: You'd think watching a woman push a car would be impressive but of course men on the internet are complaining that Brie Larson doing that is an 'easy' task.
description:
Brie Larson literally pushed a car in her Captain Marvel training, and men have problems with it. Yes, you read that right. Larson did, in fact, push a car all on her lonesome, and it was awesome—not just a little electric car, either. Brie got behind a 5,000-pound Jeep with a full tank of gas and a PERSON IN THE CAR and pushed it with a smile on her face.

Look, at this point, it’s just getting ridiculous. Women existing and being celebrated for things is not a personal attack on men, no matter how many of them insist on seeing it that way.

When Larson made the statement that she wanted to diversify her press tour, of course there was an up-in-arms response from men (white men in particular) complaining that they weren’t going to get coverage even though that wasn’t the point.

In fact, Brie Larson is working twice as hard to make sure that everyone is included, and yes, that means the white male critics who are too worried about being left out to see that Captain Marvel isn’t their time.

read more

blog.name: xxmisty
blog.title: Land of Coffee and Insanity
blog.description: Hello, I'm John/Mist! I'm a disabled transgender artist from the UK. I am the Mangle, the Mangle is me! My Art: Commissions are open! | Drop me an ask for more info and check my art tag to see some of my work! I greatly appreciate any support you can throw my way to help cover the cost of my medications and getting back on T which I've been unable to afford for the last 2 years My Patreon | My Ko-Fi Page | PayPal donations My Blog: Tumblr has decided boobs are yesterday's news so where once there were cosplays you'll now find mostly my fandom-related art, rambling and memetastic posts. Fandom slave to: Runaways, Spiderverse, MCU (and Marvel in general), Venom, Homestuck, Animal Crossing, Five Nights at Freddy's, She-Ra (SPoP and MOTU), Gorillaz, Splatoon, Arms, Doctor Who, Red Dwarf, Black Mirror, Guardians of the Galaxy, Deadpool, Cloverfield, Ashes to Ashes, Life on Mars, Pokemon, DHMIS, Hiveswap, Legend of Zelda, classic Sonic, 80s and 90s nostalgia, fun and games from the Highly Medicated Corner and nutty shenannigans with my betrothed beautiful fiancee and lovely partner Lucy :) About Me: I'm a transguy who enjoys cross dressing for cosplays, I live on a boat, I'm demisexual and am SO super lucky to have found my Moirspritmaterail, best friend, lover, soul mate, lovely partner for life ❤️💛💚💙💜 I am xX-Misty on FFnet and Fictionpress. More About Me why would you even click here??!) Moirspritmaterail tag Highly Medicated Corner Not Even Highly Medicated Corner

summary: Welcome to Marvel March! To celebrate the release of Captain Marvel in three weeks’ time and because there are so many...
caption:
Welcome to Marvel March!

To celebrate the release of Captain Marvel in three weeks’ time and because there are so many characters in the marvel universe that I’d love to draw I decided to give myself a challenge to draw one marvel-related picture every day throughout March. I’m hoping this will help me speed up my drawing a little and to draw some of the characters I don’t think i’d have a chance to draw otherwise. My fiancée Lucy (who got me into the world of marvel in the first place) is going to join in too and we’ll be sharing our art through a new side blog every day:

http://marvelmarch.tumblr.com

With Captain Marvel, End Game and TV series including season 2 of Cloak and Dagger coming up in the next couple of months we thought maybe there were other fans who’d like to join in too so i’ve made three sets of prompts for anyone who feels like being part of the challenge:

There’s a general set, for Marvel fans who enjoy both the comics and the movies, and there’s a dedicated set of comic prompts and a dedicated set of MCU prompts for anyone who wants to concentrate on one or the other. Feel free to mix and match, and if completing one every day is too much of a strain to fit into your daily routine you can choose to complete every other day, or one per week, or even stretch the challenge out beyond March. The only hard and fast rule is to enjoy yourself :)

If art isn’t your thing then there are plenty of other ways you can complete the challenge. Here are some suggestions:

- sketching, painting, cartooning, any kind of hand drawn art
- writing drabbles, mini-fics, poems
- posting screenshots, gifs, comic panels, quotes
- sculpture, clay, crafts
- videos, vlogs, animation
- a ten thousand word essay complete with references and corrections in red
- literally writing a sentence to answer the question!

It would be AMAZING to see other marvel fans coming together to celebrate the best and the worst from the marvel universe so if you think your followers might enjoy taking part please consider reblogging the prompts, and if you decide to join in then tag your posts with marvel march so that we can check them out and reblog as many as we can on the sideblog.

And don’t forget to follow the marvel march tag for updates and to see our completed prompts!

summary: Due nuovi poster internazionali per Captain Marvel
title: Due nuovi poster internazionali per Captain Marvel
body:
Due nuovi poster internazionali per Captain Marvel

I Marvel Studios hanno rilasciato – via Imp Awards – due nuovi poster grafici di Captain Marvel, il prossimo capitolo del Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Captain Marvel è diretto da Anna Boden e Ryan Fleck. La sceneggiatura è di Ginevra Robertson-Dworet e Nicole Perlman. Nel cast Brie Larson, Samuel L. Jackson, Ben Mendelsohn, Jude Law, Gemma Chan, Lashana Lynch, Lee Pace, Clark Gregg, Djimon…

View On WordPress

summary: "Danvers!" Officer Cadet Chen, her title referring to a military trainee studying to become a fully commissioned officer,...
body:
“Danvers!” Officer Cadet Chen, her title referring to a military trainee studying to become a fully commissioned officer, appears as if from nowhere. The Officer Cadets here are often just called “OCs,” for brevity.

“Yes, ma'am,” I say, my eyes wrenching open and my voice clipped and efficient.

“Would you like to take the oath again?” I’m probably a good six inches taller than Officer Cadet Chen. And yet there’s no doubt in my mind that she could defeat me—and definitely humiliate me—in every possible way. Her black hair is cut short, and her voice is disarmingly composed. Her face is serene as she waits my reply.

“No, ma'am,” I say, unsure of why I’m being asked.

“Well then, where is your flight, Basic?”

I look around and feel my face heat.

My flight is long gone. Since we got here, the thousand-strong class of basic cadets has been divided into smaller and smaller groups by the cadet cadre of upperclassmen. Each division has resulted in less and less anonymity. This is not a welcome realization. One thousand became ten one-hundred-cadet squadrons. And then those one hundred became thirty. And then those thirty became my flight. And in my flight, there are only four women. But right now, it’s just me, Officer Cadet Chen, Officer Jenks, and the stolen moment that got me into this mess.

“Can you please do your job and get her out of here?” Jenks’s voice is an indifferent sigh.

“Yes, sir,” Chen says. She takes a deep breath before unleashing the hounds of hell. But just as she’s about to speak, Jenks raises a single leisurly hand. Chen immediately stops, standing at attention as he walks over to me. I am still, staring forward. Jenks walks around me. I can hear his breathing and the squeak of his shoes. The hairs on the back of my neck stand on end as he comes to a stop in front of me. Jenks’s lips curl in disappointment as he takes up my measure.

“They’ll let anyone in these days,” Jenks comments. His gaze slides from me over to Chen. “Truly anyone.” Chen’s eyes stay forward, but I notice the flicker as his words strike her right in the chest.

The next flight enters to take their Oath of Enlistment and Jenks dismisses both Chen and me with a wave of his hand. We turn on our heels and exit the room, Jenks having stripped Chen of any power she had. In that room—and in Jenks’s eyes—we are both equally disappointing.

Excerpt from Higher, Further, Faster by Liza Palmer

summary: GO SEE CAPTIAN MARVEL OPENING WEEKEND
body:
GO SEE CAPTIAN MARVEL OPENING WEEKEND

Guys!! I just read an article on cosmicbook.news saying that the box office predictions for Captain Marvels opening weekend is said to have dropped over 80%. DONT LET THIS HAPPEN!! Prove those comic fuck boys wrong and go see the heck out of that movie! Support Brie Larson and this movie that’s going to be a fantastic movie and origin story!
